1.title: Pilot
1.description: A strangely eccentric genius scientist and inventor, moves into the home of his daughter and her family and begins to strongly influence his young grandson.

1.title: Lawnmower Dog
1.description: Rick helps Jerry out with the dog.

1.title: Anatomy Park
1.description: It's Christmas. Rick shrinks Morty, injecting him into a homeless man to save Anatomy Park. Jerry tries to have a Christmas free of electronic devices, but regrets his decision when his parents introduce him to their new friend.

1.title: M. Night Shaym-Aliens!
1.description: Rick and Morty try to get to the bottom of a mystery.

1.title: Meeseeks and Destroy
1.description: Rick provides the family with a solution to their problems, freeing him up to go on an adventure led by Morty.

1.title: Rick Potion #9
1.description: After Rick gives Morty a love potion for a school dance, things quickly spiral out of control when the serum splices with the flu - causing it to spread. Rick and Morty scramble to cure the crisis, making matters worse in the process.

1.title: Raising Gazorpazorp
1.description: Morty becomes a father to an alien baby, while Rick and Summer get trapped in a dangerous dimension.

1.title: Rixty Minutes
1.description: Rick hooks up the family's TV with interdimensional cable, allowing them to watch infinite TV from across the multiverse.

1.title: Something Ricked This Way Comes
1.description: Summer gets a job at a pawn shop owned by the devil. Jerry helps Morty with his science fair project.

1.title: Close Rick-counters of the Rick Kind
1.description: Rick, falsely blamed for Murder by the council of Ricks, begins a cross-dimensional pursuit with the authorities while attempting to prove his innocence.

1.title: Ricksy Business
1.description: Beth and Jerry head for an iceberg of a date leaving Rick in charge. Morty doesn't get to go on any more adventures if the house isn't in the same condition when they get back.

2.title: A Rickle in Time
2.description: Having restarted time, Rick, Morty and Summer are in a quantum-uncertain state of existence. An argument leads to the creation of two alternate timelines, which need to be stitched back together fast if they are to escape quantum collapse.

2.title: Mortynight Run
2.description: Rick and Morty try to save a gas life form while Jerry resides in a daycare made for Jerrys.

2.title: Auto Erotic Assimilation
2.description: Rick gets emotional. Beth and Jerry get into a fight.

2.title: Total Rickall
2.description: The Smith house is locked down after parasites threaten to take over the world by multiplying through flashbacks.

2.title: Get Schwifty
2.description: Rick and morty must aid Earth after a giant head disrupts the planet, demanding to see a hit song performed.

2.title: The Ricks Must Be Crazy
2.description: Rick is having trouble with his car and they have to fix it by traveling to the microverse.

2.title: Big Trouble in Little Sanchez
2.description: Rick joins in on some hijinks by transferring his consciousness into teenage "Tiny Rick." Beth and Jerry sort out their relationship.

2.title: Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate
2.description: Jerry is faced with the difficult decision of losing his manhood in order to save an alien leader from imminent death. Meanwhile, Rick, Morty and Summer explore the possibilities of interdimensional television.

2.title: Look Who's Purging Now
2.description: Rick and Morty arrive on an alien planet to fix their ship just as the day of the purge begins there, Jerry and Summer work on their father-daughter relationship, but his lack of employment keeps coming up.

2.title: The Wedding Squanchers
2.description: The Smith family is invited to the wedding of Rick's best friend, Birdperson. Things go south when it's discovered that the bride isn't who she says she is.

3.title: The Rickshank Rickdemption
3.description: Rick, still in galactic prison, puts an intricate escape plan into action. Back on Earth, which is now under federation control, Morty and Summer have an argument about their grandpa.

3.title: Rickmancing the Stone
3.description: With the kids dealing with their parents' divorce, Rick takes them to a Mad Max-style universe where he tries to steal a green crystal from a group of scavengers.

3.title: Pickle Rick
3.description: Rick turns himself into a pickle while Beth, Summer, and Morty go to family therapy.

3.title: Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender
3.description: Rick and Morty are summoned by the Vindicators to stop Worldender but end up in a deathtrap conceived by Drunk Rick.

3.title: The Whirly Dirly Conspiracy
3.description: Rick takes Jerry on a sympathy adventure to a resort where everyone is immortal when there, and Jerry meets some old acquaintances of Rick's who want payback.

3.title: Rest and Ricklaxation
3.description: Following a stressful adventure, Rick and Morty go on a break to a spa where they remove their toxins, which in turn take a form of their own.

3.title: The Ricklantis Mixup
3.description: Whilst Rick and Morty go off to adventure in Atlantis, we take a look at how the Citadel has rebuilt itself since both Rick and Morty visited.

3.title: Morty's Mind Blowers
3.description: Rick reveals to Morty his "Morty's mind blowers," a collection of memories Morty asked Rick to erase from his mind.

3.title: The ABCs of Beth
3.description: Rick brings Beth to a world he created for her when she was younger while Beth looks for a long-lost childhood friend trapped there for years.

3.title: The Rickchurian Mortydate
3.description: Rick and Morty are called upon by the president to kill a vicious alien in the secret tunnels under the White House.

4.title: Edge of Tomorty: Rick Die Rickpeat
4.description: Rick brings Morty to a planet containing crystals that show whoever is touching them all the ways they may die depending on their choices.

4.title: The Old Man and the Seat
4.description: Rick goes to his private bathroom to find that someone else has used it. Jerry creates an app with an unlikely alien and Morty pays the price.

4.title: One Crew over the Crewcoo's Morty
4.description: On a treasure-seeking expedition in an alien temple, Rick and Morty discover that a heist expert has snatched the prize from under their noses. Further twists, turns and double-crosses abound.

4.title: Claw and Hoarder: Special Ricktim's Morty
4.description: Morty asks Rick for a dragon and Rick finds a wizard of another dimension who makes a soul bonding contract between Morty and a dragon called Balthromaw. Meanwhile, Jerry meets a talking cat in his bedroom who wants to fly to Florida.

4.title: Rattlestar Ricklactica
4.description: Morty discovers a race of intelligent space snakes after suffering a potentially lethal bite. Jerry attempts to prove that he isn't completely incompetent.

4.title: Never Ricking Morty
4.description: An anthology episode that follows Rick and Morty on a train with people who don't like Rick. They have to find their way out but they bump into unexpected situations along the way.

4.title: Promortyus
4.description: Rick, Morty and Summer visit an alien civilisation, where Rick and Morty are controlled by parasites and Summer lives a luxurious lifestyle.

4.title: The Vat of Acid Episode
4.description: Rick & Morty go on a simple exchange as Rick tells Morty if something goes wrong jump into the same vat of acid as he does.

4.title: Childrick of Mort
4.description: Rick, Morty, Beth, Summer and Jerry share a galactic adventure.

4.title: Star Mort Rickturn of the Jerri
4.description: An adventure with an invisibility belt, but a family that disappears together, must stay together.

5.title: Mort Dinner Rick Andre
5.description: Rick hosts dinner for his ocean dwelling nemesis, while Morty gets the wine.

5.title: Mortyplicity
5.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: A Rickconvenient Mort
5.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Episode #5.4
5.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Tourist Trapped
1.description: After finding a strange book in the forest, Dipper begins to learn about the dark side of Gravity Falls, and suspects that Mabel's new boyfriend is a zombie.

1.title: The Legend of the Gobblewonker
1.description: Stan takes the kids fishing for the day, but they ditch him to search for a lake monster called the Gobblewonker in order to win a photo contest.

1.title: Headhunters
1.description: The kids discover Stan's collection of wax sculptures, and Mabel decides to create her own. But when someone sabotages it, it's up to her and Dipper to solve the case.

1.title: The Hand That Rocks the Mabel
1.description: Dipper and Mabel go to see Stan's arch nemesis, a psychic by the name of Lil' Gideon, who becomes obsessed with Mabel.

1.title: The Inconveniencing
1.description: Dipper tries to impress Wendy by going along with her and her friends to an abandoned convenience store that may be haunted.

1.title: Dipper vs. Manliness
1.description: In order to become more manly, Dipper seeks the help of a gang of minotaurs in the forest. Meanwhile, Mabel gives Stan a makeover.

1.title: Double Dipper
1.description: Stan throws a big party to promote the Mystery Shack, while Dipper uses a strange photocopier to make clones of himself, so that he can impress Wendy.

1.title: Irrational Treasure
1.description: During Gravity Falls' Pioneer Day celebration, the kids attempt to uncover a conspiracy about the town's real founder.

1.title: The Time Traveler's Pig
1.description: Dipper ruins a chance to impress Wendy at a fair, forcing him to use a time machine to travel back and stop it from happening.

1.title: Fight Fighters
1.description: Dipper is challenged to a fight by Wendy's boyfriend Robbie, and brings video game character Rumble McSkirmish to life in order to serve as his bodyguard.

1.title: Little Dipper
1.description: Dipper finds a magic crystal with the ability to grow and shrink anything, but Gideon gets his hands on it and tries to get revenge on Stan and take the Mystery Shack.

1.title: Summerween
1.description: It's Summerween, and Dipper and Mabel are visited by a monster called the Summerween Trickster, who informs them they must collect 500 pieces of candy, or be eaten.

1.title: Boss Mabel
1.description: Mabel is in charge of the Mystery Shack after making a bet with Stan to see who can the most money in three days, and determine which of them is the better boss.

1.title: Bottomless Pit!
1.description: Dipper, Mabel, Stan, and Soos accidentally fall into the Mystery Shack's bottomless pit and tell each other stories to pass the time.

1.title: The Deep End
1.description: It's the hottest day of the Summer and the opening day of the Gravity Falls pool, where Mabel befriends a mysterious boy named Mermando.

1.title: Carpet Diem
1.description: Dipper wants his own room and when Soos finds one in the shack, Stan makes Dipper and Mabel compete for it. Meanwhile, Dipper has found out that the shag rug inside let's you switch bodies with whomever you shock.

1.title: Boyz Crazy
1.description: When Mabel Discovers that her favourite boy band is actually a bunch of imprisoned clones, she sets them free, only to decide on keeping them for herself; Dipper is convinced that Robbie plans to brainwash Wendy with a secret message.

1.title: Land Before Swine
1.description: A dinosaur loose in Gravity Falls snatches up Mabel's pig, Waddles, leading the Pines family on a prehistoric journey to get him back.

1.title: Dreamscaperers
1.description: Dipper, Mabel and Soos go through Stan's mind to defeat a tricky demon summoned by Lil Gideon.

1.title: Gideon Rises
1.description: When Lil' Gideon takes over the Shack, Dipper and Mabel try to defeat him.

2.title: Scary-oke
2.description: The Pines Family resolves to get back to normal by throwing a "Mystery Shack is Back" party ... but nothing is normal in Gravity Falls!

2.title: Into the Bunker
2.description: When Dipper's secret journal pages lead him and the gang to the author's hidden bunker, they find themselves coming face to face with a mysterious figure from Gravity Falls' history.

2.title: The Golf War
2.description: After being belittled by Pacifica too many times, Mabel challenges her to a miniature golf off, which gets out of control when some local residents offer their help.

2.title: Sock Opera
2.description: Close to unlocking the author's laptop, Dipper is visited by the demon Bill, who wants to make a deal. Mabel puts on a puppet show to impress a boy.

2.title: Soos and the Real Girl
2.description: Soos makes a promise to his grandma that he can find a girlfriend in one week, and buys a dating simulator game to help him learn how to talk to women.

2.title: Little Gift Shop of Horrors
2.description: Stan tells a series of three spooky tales to an unlucky customer at the Mystery Shack after hours.

2.title: Society of the Blind Eye
2.description: Dipper and the gang discover a secret society that has been erasing the memories of the citizens of Gravity Falls.

2.title: Blendin's Game
2.description: Blendin returns to face off with Dipper and Mabel in a futuristic battle that could trap them forever in time jail.

2.title: The Love God
2.description: After seeing Robbie's sadness over his and Wendy's breakup, Mabel steals a love potion from a Love God.

2.title: Northwest Mansion Mystery
2.description: Pacifica invites Dipper over to her mansion in order to get rid of a ghost.

2.title: Not What He Seems
2.description: The twins wonder if they really know Grunkle Stan after he is taken into custody by the government agents.

2.title: A Tale of Two Stans
2.description: The reuniting of the Pine brothers Stanford and Stanley. A series of flashbacks from their lives are shown, and their history together is explained.

2.title: Dungeons, Dungeons, and More Dungeons
2.description: Dipper finds an unlikely friend to join him with his newest obsession- a nerdy board game called "Dungeons, Dungeons and More Dungeons."

2.title: The Stanchurian Candidate
2.description: When Grunkle Stan decides to run for mayor, Dipper and Mabel have their work cut out for them trying to turn their gaffe-prone uncle into the perfect candidate.

2.title: The Last Mabelcorn
2.description: A new threat leads Mabel to venture into the enchanted realm of the unicorns. Meanwhile, Dipper learns an unexpected twist about the enigmatic Bill Cipher.

2.title: Roadside Attraction
2.description: Grunkle Stan takes the kids with him on a road-trip to sabotage all the other tourist traps in Oregon.

2.title: Dipper and Mabel vs. the Future
2.description: As Dipper and Mabel's 13th birthday approaches, Ford and Dipper go on a dangerous mission.

2.title: Weirdmageddon: Part 1
2.description: Bill has returned to take down the Pines family. But this time he has brought some of his friends with him.

2.title: Weirdmageddon 2: Escape from Reality
2.description: While Dipper, Soos, and Wendy try to save Mabel from a strange new world, Bill's forces plan their next move.

2.title: Weirdmageddon 3: Take Back the Falls
2.description: The Pines family make their greatest sacrifice yet and arrive at their ultimate fate following a final showdown with Bill.

1.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender
1.description: Sokka and his sister Kya - later renamed Katara, must travel the world to find masters for Aang, who is the Avatar. However, they must evade a critical foe, Prince Zuko of the Fire Nation, who wants to capture Aang.

1.title: The Boy in the Iceberg
1.description: The legend of the Avatar is told. Katara and Sokka find a strange boy within an iceberg.

1.title: The Avatar Returns
1.description: Aang and Katara inadvertently set off a trap the brings the warmongering Fire Nation to the Southern Water Tribe's peaceful village at the South Pole.

1.title: The Southern Air Temple
1.description: After his departure from the Southern Air Temple 100 years ago, an excited Aang finally returns home but is disillusioned by what he finds there.

1.title: The Warriors of Kyoshi
1.description: The gang arrives at Kyoshi Island and are captured by some Kyoshi warriors. When Aang reveals that he is the avatar, news quickly spreads out and suddenly reaches to Prince Zuko who then goes to Kyoshi Island to capture him.

1.title: The King of Omashu
1.description: Aang's abilities as an airbender are challenged by a king.

1.title: Imprisoned
1.description: In a nearby Earth Village, the gang meets a teenage earthbender named Haru. This village lives in fear of the Fire Nation, for soldiers there capture any earthbenders they can find.

1.title: The Spirit World: Winter Solstice, Part 1
1.description: Aang and friends visit a village being terrorized by an angry spirit. Iroh is captured by Earth Kingdom soldiers.

1.title: Avatar Roku: Winter Solstice, Part 2
1.description: To contact the spirit of the previous Avatar, Aang must reach a temple in the Fire Nation before the sun sets on the following day. There he will learn what he must do to restore balance to the world. Zuko must defy his banishment to follow Aang.

1.title: The Waterbending Scroll
1.description: Katara, desperate to improve her abilities and teach Aang, steals an expensive waterbending scroll from pirates, causing them to pursue the group.

1.title: Jet
1.description: Aang, Katara, and Sokka have their friendship tested by a charismatic Rebel Leader who is fighting against the Fire Nation.

1.title: The Great Divide
1.description: Aang is tested as the Avatar when he must help two feuding clans cross a dangerous canyon peacefully.

1.title: The Storm
1.description: Aang relives the events after finding out that he is the Avatar 100 years ago and tells them to Katara, while Iroh tells the story of Zuko's scar and banishment to the crew.

1.title: The Blue Spirit
1.description: When Aang is captured by the Fire Nation, his only hope is a mysterious masked figure.

1.title: The Fortuneteller
1.description: The gang visits a village where a fortuneteller lives who is said to never be wrong. Aang tries to show Katara how he feels about her.

1.title: Bato of the Water Tribe
1.description: Sokka and Katara meet a friend of their father who offers to take them to join the Water Tribe's navy. Aang fears his friends will choose seeing their father again over staying with him.

1.title: The Deserter
1.description: When he meets an outcast from the Fire Nation, Aang is impatient to skip ahead in his training.

1.title: The Northern Air Temple
1.description: Aang is upset when he finds an old Air Temple has been desecrated by an old inventor and his son.

1.title: The Waterbending Master
1.description: The heroes finally arrive at the North Pole. But for Katara, the trip may have been in vain, as Master Pakku refuses to teach girls waterbending.

1.title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
1.description: While Katara herself becomes a great waterbending master, Commander Zhao plans a siege on the Northern Water Tribe. Meanwhile, Sokka's on a mission to stop this siege while Aang tries to buy them some time.

1.title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
1.description: As the Fire Nation continues its assault on the Northern Water Tribe, Sokka, Katara and Yue set out on a search for Aang, being guided by his spirit.

2.title: The Avatar State
2.description: Aang and friends arrive in the Earth Kingdom to begin his earthbending training, but a local general convinces Aang that all he needs to do is learn to control his Avatar state. Azula, Zuko's sister, arrives to escort her brother and uncle back to the Fire Nation.

2.title: The Cave of Two Lovers
2.description: On their way to Omashu, Team Avatar is forced to travel underground to avoid Fire Nation attacks. Iroh and Zuko adjust to life as fugitives.

2.title: Return to Omashu
2.description: Finding the city of Aang's old friend, King Bumi, captured by the Fire Nation, the heroes hatch a plan to rescue Aang's earthbending teacher. Azula gathers two old friends to help her hunt the Avatar.

2.title: The Swamp
2.description: Aang hears a swamp calling to him. In the swamp, Aang and the gang find out that this is not any natural swamp.

2.title: Avatar Day
2.description: Sokka and Katara have to solve a centuries-old crime when Aang is imprisoned for a murder allegedly committed by one of his past incarnations.

2.title: The Blind Bandit
2.description: While looking for an Earthbending teacher, Aang, and his friends discover a young blind girl with secrets of her own.

2.title: Zuko Alone
2.description: As Zuko tries to make it by in exile without his uncle, he remembers how his father became Firelord and what happened to his mother.

2.title: The Chase
2.description: Every time they land, Azula and her warriors find Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Toph. Toph refuses to help set up camp, claiming she carries her own weight and no one else's. After a fight between Aang, Katara and Toph, Toph storms off angrily. Aang lays a decoy trail for Azula and Sokka, Katara, Appa, and Momo, flee the other direction. Aang waits for Azula and is fighting her when Zuko and Iroh arrive. Soon, Katara, and Sokka come to the fight, too. Just as all hope of winning is lost, Toph arrives and, together, the six attack Azula. Knowing she is beat, Azula shoots ...

2.title: Bitter Work
2.description: Aang begins to learn earthbending from Toph; Uncle Iroh resumes teaching Zuko firebending to better prepare him for facing Azula, and reveals a new technique he learned from watching waterbenders.

2.title: The Library
2.description: When he learns that there is a lost Library with all the knowledge in the world, Sokka convinces the others to seek it out in hopes of finding a weakness of the Fire Nation.

2.title: The Desert
2.description: Lost in the desert without Appa, Team Avatar must find a way out. Iroh and Zuko make contact with a secret organization.

2.title: The Serpent's Pass
2.description: After getting tickets for the ferry headed to Ba Sing Se, the gang meets an old friend. They skip the ferry ride to help some refugees, one of which is going to have a baby, get to Ba Sing Se. They must lead the refugees through the Serpent's Pass, a dangerous mountain-side path surrounded by water.

2.title: The Drill
2.description: After arriving at the great wall of Ba Sing Se, Aang and the gang discover that the Fire Nation has constructed a great drilling machine to penetrate the wall. The drill is also followed by an army of Fire Nation troops. Also, Zuko and Iroh are having trouble hiding the fact that they are both Firebenders.

2.title: City of Walls and Secrets
2.description: After getting a house to stay in, Aang and company are given a tour of Ba Sing Se. As they try to get in to tell the Earth King the news, they find that nothing is quite what is seems. Jet is in the city, too, and he is positive that Iroh and Zuko are Firebenders.

2.title: The Tales of Ba Sing Se
2.description: A series of short stories covering some of the time spent by Katara, Toph, Iroh, Sokka, Aang, Zuko and Momo as they live in Ba Sing Se.

2.title: Appa's Lost Days
2.description: In this special episode, we go back in time to the moment Appa was stolen, will find out where he has gone and who he has met along the way and more importantly where he is now!

2.title: Lake Laogai
2.description: The Avatar gang encounters Jet in Ba Sing Se and he helps them to discover the location of Appa. But they will end up discovering something else, a secret of the city.

2.title: The Earth King
2.description: The kids battle Long Feng and the Dai Li when they attempt to show the Earth King the vast conspiracy taking place in his city. Zuko becomes seriously ill and has feverish dreams as he faces a spiritual crisis.

2.title: The Guru
2.description: Aang receives guidance from Guru Pathik at the Eastern Air Temple; Sokka is reunited with his long-lost father; Princess Azula has something diabolical in store for her enemies; Uncle and Zuko run their own tea shop.

2.title: The Crossroads of Destiny
2.description: The heroes work together to stop Azula's destructive plans; Zuko finds companionship in an unlikely source and learns the time has come to make an imperative choice about his future.

3.title: The Awakening
3.description: Weeks after the fall of the Earth Kingdom, Aang and his friends must infiltrate the Fire Nation. Katara meets her father for the first time in years. Zuko returns home, but is uneasy with his newfound reputation.

3.title: The Headband
3.description: Posing as a regular kid, Aang goes to a Fire Nation school and sees what's missing from their lives. Zuko visits his uncle in prison.

3.title: The Painted Lady
3.description: When Aang and his friends come across a fishing village being poisoned by a nearby factory, a local legend comes to life to help the townspeople.

3.title: Sokka's Master
3.description: After deciding he's the least valuable member of the team, Sokka seeks an apprenticeship with a sword-master. The rest of the gang tries to adjust to being without him. The imprisoned Iroh may not be as beaten as he seems.

3.title: The Beach
3.description: On a forced vacation, Zuko, Azula, Ty Lee and Mai try to blend in with normal teenagers and learn about themselves and one another. Aang and company are attacked by an ominous assassin.

3.title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
3.description: Both Aang and Zuko must learn the history of how the war began. Zuko learns a secret about his great-grandfather's past.

3.title: The Runaway
3.description: When Toph discovers a quick way to make cash, Katara disapproves, and the rift between them has disastrous consequences.

3.title: The Puppetmaster
3.description: Creepy things are afoot when the gang meets a mysterious old innkeeper with a secret.

3.title: Nightmares and Daydreams
3.description: As the invasion approaches, Aang has recurring nightmares about being unprepared to face the Firelord. Zuko feels the perks and pressures of being the prince again.

3.title: Day of the Black Sun
3.description: Zuko makes a decision about his future. Aang reunites with many of his old friends in a full-scale invasion of the Fire Nation capitol to coincide with an eclipse which will remove the Fire Nation's powers.

3.title: Day of the Black Sun
3.description: The invasion seems to be succeeding until Aang learns that their arrival was anticipated. Zuko confronts his father.

3.title: The Western Air Temple
3.description: The gang hides out in the Western Air Temple. Zuko tries to convince the gang of his change in heart, but they are very hesitant. Combustion Man/Sparky-Sparky Boom Man attacks again.

3.title: The Firebending Masters
3.description: Zuko has joined up with Aang's group and is now ready to teach Aang fire bending. Unfortunately, Zuko has found out that he has lost his ability and must now relearn it. Zuko and Aang travel to find the original source of fire bending so that they both can learn from The Firebending Masters.

3.title: The Boiling Rock: Part 1
3.description: Sokka and Zuko head to the Fire Nation's most heavily guarded prison, the Boiling Rock, in hopes of finding and breaking out the captured invasion force.

3.title: The Boiling Rock
3.description: The escape is planned and the heroes attempt to break from the prison that very day. But problems come when Azula, Mai and Ty Lee arrive at the prison.

3.title: The Southern Raiders
3.description: Trying to prove that she can trust him, Zuko helps Katara track down the man who killed her mother.

3.title: The Ember Island Players
3.description: The gang, now hiding at Ember Island, watch a play about themselves and their adventures.

3.title: Sozin's Comet
3.description: Sozin's Comet is only three days away. Zuko tells the others what the Fire Lord plans on the day of the comet and the gang realizes that they must stop him before then. But Aang doubts that he can do what is expected of him.

3.title: Sozin's Comet
3.description: Aang awakes on a mysterious island and confronts his past lives for advice on how to stop the Fire Lord without killing him. The rest of the group searches for Aang.

3.title: Sozin's Comet
3.description: Zuko battles his sister with Katara's help for the right to be named Fire Lord. Elsewhere, Aang meets Ozai just as the comet arrives.

3.title: Sozin's Comet, Part 4: Avatar Aang
3.description: Aang's moment of truth arrives. Can he defeat Ozai, the Phoenix King? Will he be forced to take a human life? All the characters face their greatest challenges.

1.title: Arthur's Eyes/Francine's Bad Hair Day
1.description: "Arthur's Eyes": After Arthur has an eye exam, he learns that he needs to wear glasses. But when he wears them at school for the first time, Francine calls him a "Four Eyes," and the other kids laugh at him. So he tries to avoid wearing his glasses/"Francine's Bad Hair Day": Francine doesn't care that it's school picture day, but Muffy thinks that she can change Francine's mind and her looks. So Muffy advises Francine to wear a dress and to get her hair styled. But when Arthur and Buster see Francine's new look, they make fun of her.

1.title: Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn/Arthur's Spelling Trubble
1.description: "Arthur and the Real Mr. Ratburn": Arthur and his classmates are afraid of their new teacher Mr. Ratburn. 4th grader Prunella tells the recent 3rd graders that Mr. Ratburn eats nails for breakfast, he is a vampire with hypnotic powers, and that if you get an answer wrong, he will send you to "Death Row." But is this what Mr. Ratburn is really like?/"Arthur's Spelling Trubble": Arthur is one of the students who will be in the all-school spellathon. He doesn't think that he is good speller, but Mr. Ratburn thinks otherwise. Arthur studies extra-hard, but he feels like ...

1.title: D.W. All Wet/Buster's Dino Dilemma
1.description: D.W. All Wet: D.W. enjoys her field trip at the aquarium...until she sees an octopus. It gets so hot in Elwood City that Mr. Read suggests that the family should go to Bear Lake. But D.W. refuses to go because she thinks that there are octopuses in the lake./Buster's Dino Dilemma: When Mr. Ratburn's class goes on a field trip to Rainbow Rock State Park, Buster finds a dinosaur fossil and wants to keep it for himself.

1.title: D.W.'s Imaginary Friend/Arthur's Lost Library Book
1.description: D.W.'s Imaginary Friend: Arthur doesn't like D.W.'s imaginary friend Nadine. When Arthur and Buster want to go on this new ride at Wonder World, D.W. begs to go on the ride also. But Arthur thinks that D.W. will embarrass him talking about Nadine in front of his friends./Arthur's Lost Library Book: Arthur borrows a lot of books from the library, including the newest 'Scare-Your-Pants-Off' book, 'The Mysterious Hand'. Arthur forgets that he had 'The Mysterious Hand' and tries to find it before he has to return it.

1.title: Arthur's Pet Business/D.W. the Copycat
1.description: Arthur's Pet Business: Arthur wants a dog. His parents will let him have a dog on one condition, that he can prove that he is responsible enough to take care of one. So Arthur decides to run a pet-sitting business. Arthur is careful to follow all the instructions on how to take care of Perky, Mrs. Wood's dog, but no matter what he does, Perky always growls./D.W. the Copycat: When Arthur tells D.W. that everything she likes is boring, she decides to copy Arthur by doing everything he does and by dressing like him.

1.title: Locked in the Library/Arthur Accused!
1.description: 'Locked in the Library': Francine is mad at Arthur because she heard that he called her a marshmallow. But then they are assigned to work together on a report about heroes. When the two of them do research in the Elwood City Library, they doze off. When they wake up, they realize that the library is closed and won't open until Monday. Will Arthur and Francine ever make up?/ Arthur Accused: Arthur has collected quarters for a new dog for the Elwood City Fire Department, but Mrs. MacGrady says that she never got them. Mr. Haney thinks that Arthur stole the quarters. Can...

1.title: Arthur Goes to Camp/Buster Makes the Grade
1.description: Arthur Goes To Camp: Arthur and his friends go to Camp Meadowcroak. Arthur sends postcards to his family telling them how it's boys vs. girls./Buster Makes the Grade: Buster is getting poor grades in school. Mr. Ratburn tells him that if he doesn't get a B on the next test, 'he won't have the pleasure of joining his friends in the fourth grade.' So Buster's friends try tutoring him.

1.title: Arthur's New Puppy/Arthur Bounces Back
1.description: 'Arthur's New Puppy': Arthur got the dog that he always wanted, but the problem is that puppy Pal is always making a mess. Can Arthur train him? If not, what will happen to Pal?/'Arthur Bounces Back': Arthur wants to buy 'Moon Boots', but he needs to earn ten dollars, and earning money isn't easy for him.

1.title: Arthur Babysits/Arthur's Cousin Catastrophe
1.description: 'Arthur Babysits': Despite warnings from D.W. and Prunella, Arthur babysits the Tibble Twins. As their babysitter, Arthur tries being tough, but the Tibbles keep misbehaving./'Arthur's Cousin Catastrophe': It's time for the annual Read Family Reunion, and Arthur dreads it because his cousin Mo is there, and every year she humiliates him.

1.title: Arthur's Birthday/Francine Frensky, Superstar
1.description: 'Arthur's Birthday': Arthur has invited all his friends to attend his birthday party. But the problem is that Muffy's birthday party is the same day. Then the boys decide to go Arthur's party and the girls to Muffy's party. But Arthur and Francine think that it would be more fun if everybody was together, so they come up with a plan./'Francine Frensky, Superstar': Whenever Francine is in a school play, she is given the worst role. Her classmates ask Mr. Ratburn to give her a good part, and so he casts Francine as Thomas Edison. But Francine lets the role go to her ...

1.title: Arthur's Baby/D.W.'s Baby
1.description: 'Arthur's Baby': Arthur is worried about what it would be like to have a new baby in the house. After Kate is born, she cries whenever Arthur holds her, but doesn't cry when D.W. holds her. When Kate cries nonstop, D.W. and Arthur try to solve the problem./'D.W.'s Baby': D.W. is very happy to have a new baby sister, but she doesn't like her as much when Kate's crying keeps her up at night, or how she stinks up the room with her dirty diapers, and she doesn't like how Kate is getting more attention than her. D.W. comes up with several plans to make Mom and Dad like her...

1.title: Arthur Writes a Story/Arthur's Lost Dog
1.description: 'Arthur Writes a Story': Mr. Ratburn gives his class an assignment: to write a story either fiction or non-fiction. Arthur decides to write the story of how he got his dog Pal. When he tells his story to D.W., she says that it is boring, and she suggests to make Pal an elephant. Then whenever Arthur tells his changed story to a friend, they keep telling him how it can be improved, and eventually becomes a really bizarre story/'Arthur's Lost Dog': The Read family are out celebrating Downtown Day in Elwood City, and suddenly Kate cries, but Mom, Dad, Arthur and D.W. ...

1.title: So Long, Spanky/Buster's New Friend
1.description: 'So Long, Spanky': D.W. has a pet bird named Spanky that she likes because he annoys Arthur, and she can dress him up. But then Spanky becomes sick and dies, and she doesn't want to replace him with any other pet. However, when a toad comes into the Reads' yard and follows D.W. around, she gets frustrated because it won't go away./'Buster's New Friend': Instead of hanging out with Arthur, Buster hangs out with his new friend Mike. Buster boasts about how good Mike is at miniature golf and bowling. Arthur and Buster are supposed to do a science project together, but ...

1.title: Arthur the Wrecker/Arthur and the True Francine
1.description: 'Arthur the Wrecker': Arthur is obsessed with a computer game called "Deep Dark Sea." Without his mom's permission, Arthur plays some of the game so that Buster can see what it's like. When Arthur and Buster fight over the mouse, the computer turns off and they can't seem to be able to turn it back on. Can they fix it before Mrs. Read returns?/'Arthur and the True Francine': Francine reminds Muffy about the time Muffy first attended Lakewood Elementary. When they first met each other Francine and Muffy became fast friends, but Muffy tries to impress Francine more by ...

1.title: Arthur's Family Vacation/Grandpa Dave's Old Country Farm
1.description: 'Arthur's Family Vacation': Arthur wants to go to Camp Meadowcroak again this summer, but when D.W. tells him that they're going on a vacation, Arthur is disappointed. The Read Family Vacation is a disaster from the beginning. Plagued by traffic stinky diapers and unplanned pit stops. Their plans on going to the ocean are wrecked by a big rainstorm, so Arthur comes up with alternate activities./'Grandpa Dave's Old Country Farm': Arthur and D.W. spend some time at Grandpa Dave's farm. They are excited about going to the fair, but when they notice that the farm is in so...

1.title: Arthur and the Crunch Cereal Contest/D.W. Flips
1.description: 'Arthur and the Crunch Cereal Contest': Arthur tries to write a jingle for the Crunch Cereal contest, but he has trouble making up a good melody./'D.W. Flips': Whenever D.W. starts a new activity, she never wants to practice, but her mom allows her to join a gym class anyway. At the gym class, D.W.'s obstacles include "Miss Perfect" Emily, the teasing Tibbles, and not being able to do a cartwheel.

1.title: Meek for a Week/Arthur, World's Greatest Gleeper
1.description: 1. "Meek for a Week": Muffy bets Francine that Francine can't be nice for an entire week. 2. "Arthur, World's Greatest Gleeper": Arthur and Buster are stuck sitting at the "Tough Customer Table." Buster tells the Tough Customers that Arthur is really good at gleeping, not knowing what "gleep" means. Eventually, Arthur and Buster learn that "gleep" means "steal," and Arthur's reputation as a thief escalates.

1.title: Arthur's Chicken Pox/Sick as a Dog
1.description: 'Arthur's Chicken Pox': Arthur feels funny in art class. It turns out that he has the chicken pox. D.W. is jealous of the attention that Arthur is getting because he's sick. Even Grandma Thora gives Arthur special treatment/Sick as a Dog': Mr. and Mrs. Read keep telling Arthur not to give his food to Pal. One day, Arthur finds Pal acting lethargic and making weird noises. Arthur is worried about what the vet will do to Pal, and Arthur blames D.W. for making Pal sick.

1.title: D.W. Rides Again/Arthur Makes the Team
1.description: 'D.W. Rides Again': D.W. wants to ride in the bike-a-thon, but she has a trike, not a bike. Arthur offers to teach D.W. how to ride her new bike, but after the Tibble Twins tease her about using training wheels, D.W. decides that it is best for her to teach herself./'Arthur Makes the Team': Francine's dad is the new baseball coach. The kids take turns pitching so Coach Frensky can decide who would be the best. Francine pitches the ball too high, and Arthur has trouble catching balls in the outfield. Can the kids get along as a team?

1.title: Arthur's Almost Boring Day/The Half-Baked Sale
1.description: 'Arthur's Almost Boring Day': Mr. Ratburn gives his students an assignment to write a short report on what they do over the weekend. Arthur, Buster, and Francine planned on going to the park, but the rain ruins their plans. Arthur doesn't want to play with D.W. because he is embarrassed what the other kids will think. Eventually, Arthur and D.W. go over to Grandma Thora's house/'The Half-Baked Sale': Grandma Thora is a terrible cook, but Arthur and D.W. don't want to hurt her feelings. When Thora tells her grandchildren that she is in charge of the school bake sale, ...

1.title: Sue Ellen Moves In/The Perfect Brother
1.description: 'Sue Ellen Moves In': A new family has moved to Elwood City. Buster thinks they're aliens, but Arthur doesn't believe it. All the kids think that the girl, Sue Ellen, is not a normal kid. They have theories that she is an art thief or a spy. Who is she really?/'The Perfect Brother': Brain is spending the weekend at the Reads' house. Arthur is mad at Brain because Brain is always being smarter than him, being neater than him, and eating better than him.

1.title: D.W.'s Snow Mystery/Team Trouble
1.description: 'D.W.'s Snow Mystery': D.W. has kept a snowball in her freezer ever since last winter. When she discovers that it's missing, she accuses Arthur, Buster, and Francine of stealing it. Everybody has different ideas of what could have happened to the snowball and accuse each other of taking it out of the freezer./'Team Trouble': Arthur, Buster, and Francine are teamed up to do a report on Ancient Rome. Together they agree to make their report creative and decide to do a comic book. Arthur works on the 1st page, Francine the 2nd, and Buster the 3rd. But when they show each...

1.title: Bully for Binky/Mis-fortune Teller
1.description: 'Bully for Binky': Binky Barnes in the toughest kid in school, and he's always taking the other kids' desserts! So the picked-on kids try to come up with an "anti-Binky plan." Binky ruins Sue Ellen's attempt to break a rope-jumping record and that makes her mad. So she tells Binky to meet her outside the school at 3:00. When Binky learns that Sue Ellen takes classes of the martial art Tae Kwon Do, he does all he can to avoid meeting Sue Ellen./'Mis-fortune Teller': For Prunella's half-birthday, she receives a fortune-telling device called a "cootie catcher." The kids ...

1.title: Arthur's Tooth/D.W. Gets Lost
1.description: 'Arthur's Tooth': Francine calls Arthur a baby because he is the only kid in Mr. Ratburn's class who hasn't lost a baby tooth. So Arthur does all he can to get his loose tooth out./'D.W. Gets Lost': When Emily shows D.W. her new earrings, D.W. begs her parents to buy some earrings for her. Mrs. Read tells D.W. that she will take her to the department store so they can look at the earrings together and will make a decision once she sees the earrings. When D.W. and Mrs. Read are at the store, Mr. Crosswire asks Mrs. Read if she can spare 5 minutes to talk. During those ...

1.title: D.W. Thinks Big/Arthur Cleans Up
1.description: 'D.W. Thinks Big': Aunt Lucy is getting married. Arthur is the ring bearer. Cousin Cora is the flower girl. D.W. wants to help, but she's too little. When Arthur loses the ring in the church organ, D.W. finally does her part./'Arthur Cleans Up': The park is covered with trash, and Arthur wants to do something about it. Mr. Read comes up with the idea of a "kids' clean-up brigade." He tells Arthur's friends that it was all Arthur's idea, but his friends don't want to help because it means making sacrifices. Francine's dad, who is a garbage man, has all the sanitation ...

1.title: My Dad, the Garbage Man/Poor Muffy
1.description: 'My Dad, the Garbage Man': Mr. Ratburn's class has been learning about careers. Muffy's dad, Brain's mom, and Francine's dad have offered to show the class what their jobs are like. But Francine is worried what will happen when the other kids learn that her dad is a garbage man./'Poor Muffy': Muffy is allergic to the new rugs in her house. Francine suggests that Muffy stay at her apartment until all the carpet is taken out. While staying at the Frenskys', Muffy complains about only getting three TV channels, eating leftovers, and not being allowed to play her music ...

1.title: D.W.'s Blankie/Arthur's Substitute Teacher Trouble
1.description: 'D.W.'s Blankie': D.W. takes her blankie with her wherever she goes. But somehow it ends up missing. Arthur promised to watch "Renegade Joe" with Buster, but D.W. persuades Arthur to help her look for her blankie, and D.W. has a lot of crazy theories about what happened to it./'Arthur's Substitute Teacher Trouble': Mr. Ratburn gets sick and his sister Ms. Ratburn is the substitute teacher. The students think that she'll be tough like Mr. Ratburn, but it turns out that she is an easy teacher.

1.title: I'm a Poet/The Scare-Your-Pants-Off Club!
1.description: 'I'm a Poet': Fern is the only student to sign up for the poetry contest. She bets all the other kids that they can't write a poem, and the kids are up to the challenge./'The Scare-Your-Pants-Off Club!': Kids are waiting in line at the library for the latest book in the 'Scare-Your-Pants-Off' series. But an organization called 'PAWS': Parents Against Weird Stories, wants to ban the books. So Arthur and his friends decide to make petitions to keep the books.

1.title: My Club Rules!/Stolen Bike
1.description: 'My Club Rules!': The Strawberry Festival is coming to Elwood City, and the kids have ideas for parade floats. When curious D.W. climbs up the treehouse, the kids tell her that they belong to a parade float club and that she can't join. After Muffy says that the treehouse needs fixing up and insists that everyone pays dues, the kids decide to form their own clubs./'Stolen Bike': Francine is embarrassed that her bike is old while everyone else has a new bike. After getting rid of it, she tells everyone that it was stolen.

1.title: Arthur's First Sleepover/Arthur's New Year's Eve
1.description: 'Arthur's First Sleepover': There are rumors about spaceships, and D.W. wants to take a picture of one. Arthur, Buster, and Brain are having a sleepover in Arthur's yard, and D.W. wants to be at the sleepover too so that she can take pictures of aliens. But, of course, she's not invited, so D.W. decides to pull a prank on them./'Arthur's New Years Eve': For the past few years, Arthur kept on trying to stay up until midnight for the new year, but he always fell asleep. This year he decides to not stay up at all, until his friends tell him what happens every year. But ...

2.title: Arthur Meets Mister Rogers/Draw!
2.description: 'Arthur Meets Mister Rogers': When Arthur tells his friends that Mister Rogers is going to visit their school, they say that only babies like Mister Rogers. Hearing that, Arthur changes his mind and does not tell them that Mister Rogers is staying at his house. /'Draw!': Lakewood Elementary is going to have a Teacher's Charity Carnival, where teachers perform. When Fern says that she likes Mr. Ratburn's puppet shows, Francine says that puppet shows are "boring kids' stuff." Hurt by Francine's comments, Fern gets even by drawing cartoons that make fun of Francine. The ...

2.title: Binky Barnes, Art Expert/Arthur's Lucky Pencil
2.description: 1. "Binky Barnes, Art Expert": Arthur and Buster are teamed up with Binky to do a report on a piece of art from the museum. Arthur and Buster think that they're doomed, and decide to let Binky do his report while they do a report on a different piece of art. 2. "Arthur's Lucky Pencil": Arthur uses a pencil that seems to be lucky and then lends it to his friends. But it gets shorter and shorter, so Arthur decides to use it for emergencies only.

2.title: D.W., the Picky Eater/Buster and the Daredevils
2.description: 'D.W. the Picky Eater': Because D.W. made a big fuss over the salad she was served had spinach, her mom says that she can't eat at restaurants until she learns to eat everything on her plate. Can Arthur get D.W. to eat spinach?/'Buster and the Daredevils': Arthur and Buster want Toby and Slink to teach them some skating tricks, but Toby and Slink say that they have to do some dares first. Arthur quits before the first dare, but Buster keeps on fulfilling dare after dare.

2.title: Go to Your Room, D.W/Arthur Makes a Movie
2.description: 'Arthur Makes a Movie': Because Arthur and his friends are too young to see a real "James Hound" movie, they decide to make their own/Go to Your Room, D.W.: D.W. thinks that it is unfair that she is being punished and that it's all Kate's fault.

2.title: Arthur's Underwear/Francine Frensky, Olympic Rider
2.description: 1. "Arthur's Underwear": Arthur can't stop laughing about Binky's pants splitting during class, until Arthur keeps having nightmares about his underwear. Can Buster help make the bad dreams go away? 2. "Francine Frensky, Olympic Rider": Francine has saved up enough money for riding lessons, but her sister Catherine has to take her. It turns out that Catherine is better at riding a horse than Francine is. Francine is humiliated when she overhears Stanley the instructor tell Catherine that Francine is not quite up to her level.

2.title: Buster Baxter, Cat Saver/Play it Again, D.W.
2.description: 1. "Buster Baxter, Cat Saver": Who is the biggest hero in Elwood City? Buster Baxter! Actually, all that happened was that a cat that was stuck in a tree wanted to eat the fish that was in Buster's ice cream, so the cat decided to jump onto Buster. At first, Buster tells everyone that he was just in the right place at the right time, but then he starts acting like a big shot and makes up a TV series in which his character is a super hero. 2. "Play It Again, D.W.": D.W. listens to her "Crazy Bus" CD all the time, and Arthur is tired of hearing that song. The Read ...

2.title: Arthur's TV-Free Week/Night Fright
2.description: Arthur's TV-Free Week: It's trouble, right here in Elwood City. The kids--and their parents--have all pledged not to watch TV for one whole week. That's days, hours, and a whole bunch of minutes (10,680 to be exact, as Buster is horrified to discover). Can they last? Who will be the first to break? Night Fright: Big, brave Binky Barnes. He'd be toast if people ever discovered he can't sleep without a night light. It's his deepest, darkest secret. When Arthur spends the night, and discovers the truth, Binky has no choice but to try... bribery.

2.title: Arthur vs. the Piano/The Big Blow-Up
2.description: Arthur vs. The Piano: "Local Boy Wrecks Concert!" "Bad, Bad Musician!" These are the headlines Arthur can all-too-easily imagine, after he gets stage fright during a rehearsal. Now he's terrified of playing to another audience. Will he be able to get through his recital without any mistakes? Or should he just move far, far away? The Big Blow-Up: When two very opinionated friends butt heads, look out! Can Francine and The Brain put aside their differences (their "rancor," as Brain would describe it) for the good of the soccer team? Probably not--so Arthur and Buster ...

2.title: Lost!/The Short, Quick Summer
2.description: Lost!: For an eight-year-old, Arthur is usually pretty cool. Except for D.W., there's not too much that upsets him. But one day, Arthur falls asleep on a bus and awakens in a strange--and scary--part of town. Will he ever find his way home? Can he keep himself from crying? And will D.W. ever forgive Arthur for scaring her like that? The Short, Quick Summer: Summer vacation is over? It just started! What about all those great, fun things Arthur intended to do--like have adventures and explore the unfathomable mysteries of space? As Arthur learns, you don't have to go ...

2.title: D.W. Goes to Washington/Arthur's Mystery Envelope
2.description: D.W. Goes to Washington: D.W.'s on her way to Washington. (Someone should have called ahead and warned the government). She's bored, bored, BORED by it all until she gets lost during a tour of the White House. A kind employee reunites her with her family and invites them all in for pizza. (Come to think of it, the guy sure has a nice office. And doesn't he look a little... familiar?) Arthur's Mystery Envelope: When Mr. Haney gives Arthur a sealed envelope to bring home to Mom, Arthur fears the worst. (His friends are only too eager to help him imagine what "the worst"...

2.title: D.W.'s Deer Friend/Buster Hits the Books
2.description: D.W.'s Deer Friend: The Reads go on a camping trip, and D.W. wants to bring a little bit of nature back home--a rather large deer named Walter! Buster Hits the Books: Somehow, Buster has managed to get through school without ever reading a book. But now the pressure's on--he's got just one week to finish a whole, entire book--with CHAPTERS!-- and write about it! Will he live to tell the tale?

2.title: Arthur's Faraway Friend/Arthur and the Square Dance
2.description: Arthur's Faraway Friend: Arthur's in the midst of writing a great adventure story with Buster when he gets some very bad news--Buster is leaving town to go live with his Dad for a while. Is this the end of their story? Is it the end of their friendship? Arthur and The Square Dance: Does Francine have a crush on Arthur? That's what Binky thinks--and soon even Arthur is beginning to wonder. Can Arthur avoid Francine, and her cooties, for the rest of his life?

2.title: Water and the Brain/Arthur the Unfunny
2.description: Water and The Brain: Is The Brain a snob? That seems to be the only explanation for why he won't go to Waterworld with the rest of his friends. But Arthur concludes that theory is all wet as he tries to discover what's really bugging the Brain. Arthur The Unfunny: Arthur's a notorious joke-killer. But when he's scheduled to perform as a carnival clown, Arthur decides he'll learn how to make people laugh--or else!

2.title: Sue Ellen's Lost Diary/Arthur's Knee
2.description: Sue Ellen's Lost Diary: Poor Sue Ellen has lost the one thing she's never without--her diary. But as her friends help her look for it, they start to wonder--how come she won't let them read it? What's IN this diary anyway? Arthur's Knee: Arthur's hurt his knee but won't tell Mom--because then she'd know he'd been playing down at the dump. (Where he was NOT allowed to go). Can The Brain and D.W. convince Arthur to face up to it and take his tetanus shot like a man--umm, an aardvark?

2.title: Grandma Thora Appreciation Day/Fern's Slumber Party
2.description: Grandma Thora Appreciation Day: Arthur and D.W. are planning a surprise party for Grandma Thora. They're doing it all by themselves--thank you very much--and they're not even fighting! But somehow, in the midst of all the party-planning mayhem, one teeny detail gets forgotten--the guest of honor! Fern's Slumber Party: Shy Fern hosts a slumber party at her mother's urging. Her guests are sure it will be the most boring party of all time--but when disaster strikes, Fern's special talents save the day. Or, in this case, the night!

2.title: Love Notes for Muffy/D.W. Blows the Whistle
2.description: Love Notes For Muffy: When Muffy tries to bribe the judges at the school science fair, Francine and The Brain plot revenge. But the thrill is short-lived after Muffy turns the tables, and the joke, on them. D.W. Blows The Whistle: D.W., a newly-deputized Junior Safety Officer, has a reputation for being a strict enforcer of the rules--well, OK, a tattle-tale. How far--or how high--will she go to make sure everyone is safe and sound?

2.title: Francine Redecorates/Arthur the Loser
2.description: Francine Redecorates: Francine likes bats and lizards, while Catherine's taste runs to lace. Normally, it's fun to be different, but not if you're two sisters sharing the same room. Space gets very tight at the Frensky's, when this odd couple decides they've had enough togetherness. Arthur The Loser: There's only one thing in life Arthur really wants--and that's to say "I win!" like the kids he sees on TV. But whether he's playing basketball or a brand-new board game, Arthur just can't stop losing. Is it really so wrong to... cheat a little?

2.title: Arthur vs. the Very Mean Crossing Guard/D.W.'s Very Bad Mood
2.description: Arthur vs. The Very Mean Crossing Guard: Arthur and The Brain encounter a new crossing guard on the way home from school. This guard isn't just mean, he's nuts! He charges $10 to cross the street and if you don't pay, his goons will find you!! Is this guy for real? D.W.'s Very Bad Mood: D.W. is making Arthur's life miserable! (Hard to imagine, but true.) Francine decides she'd better find the key to D.W.'s cranky behavior before Arthur loses his mind.

2.title: D.W.'s Name Game/Finders Key-pers
2.description: D.W.'s Name Game: What's in a name? A lot of hurt feelings, sometimes. At least that's what D.W. and Arthur discover when their efforts to insult each other get out of control. Although the contest improves their vocabulary, the endless name-calling becomes, well, deleterious. Finders Key-Pers: Arthur, Brain, and Binky find a key--but to what? The city? The new science museum? A brand new sports car? And which of them will get to keep whatever fabulous thing they find!? When they decide to split it 50-50-50 the trouble really begins!

2.title: How the Cookie Crumbles/Sue Ellen's Little Sister
2.description: How The Cookie Crumbles: What's a budding entrepreneur to do when her homemade cookies hit the big time? Especially when the recipe isn't really hers? Should Muffy do the right thing--or just keep quiet and rake in the dough? Sue Ellen's Littler Sister: Arthur and Francine would love to lend their sisters to Sue Ellen, who's sick of being an only child. But Sue Ellen realizes you should be careful what you wish for, after her quest for the perfect sibling leads her to... D.W.

3.title: Buster's Back/The Ballad of Buster Baxter
3.description: Arthur worries that Buster will be too sophisticated for him after traveling around the world; Buster finds that a few things have changed while he was gone.

3.title: D.W., All Fired Up/I'd Rather Read It Myself
3.description: D.W., All Fired Up: What exactly is a fire drill anyway? When Ms. Morgan announces they'll be having one during preschool, D.W. wants no part of it -- it sounds way too scary. Can she manage to stay home from school every day until the danger passes? I'd Rather Read It Myself: The Tibble Twins are better than D.W. at just about everything -- they can yell louder, bounce higher, and even get dizzier. It would be great if D.W. could at least read before the Tibbles could! Can she spin a tale dazzling enough to convince them she can?

3.title: Arthur Goes Crosswire/Sue Ellen and the Brainasaurus
3.description: Arthur Goes Crosswire: Since they rescued Wilbur Rabbit (the guy who plays Bionic Bunny on TV!), Arthur and Muffy have been inseparable. Arthur figures it's best that "Friends of Wilbur" stick together, anyway. But the rest of their friends are growing tired of the new Arthur. Can he be "de-Muffified?" Sue Ellen and The Brainasaurous: Brain's a great partner for a school assignment -- unless you wanted to work on it, too! When he's paired up with Sue Ellen for a team project, she expects to be a team player. Can Brain tolerate anyone else messing with his perfect A?

3.title: Background Blues/And Now Let's Talk to Some Kids
3.description: Background Blues: Wouldn't it be way cool to find out that your ancestors were famous frontier explorers? Or royalty? But what if, as Francine and Muffy are about to find out, they were just ... plain folks? And Now Let's Talk To Some Kids: The Magic Toolbox show is coming to Ratburn's class to put the kids on TV! The kids prepare for stardom, but a behind-the-scenes star saves the show.

3.title: The Chips Are Down/Revenge of the Chip
3.description: D.W. steals a green potato chip and to prank her, Arthur tells her that green chips are poisonous. She believes it, and worse yet, her mother starts telling everybody. With help from Binky, can D.W. learn to rise above the embarrassment?

3.title: Binky Rules/Meet Binky
3.description: In the first story, graffiti starts popping up over town saying "Binky Rules", when Binky Barnes says he's not the one doing it, it turns about to publicity stunt for a new band called "Binky". In the second story, Arthur and his friends are invited backstage to meet the band, Binky, and discover something that makes them different from other bands.

3.title: Arthur Rides the Bandwagon/Dad's Dessert Dilemma
3.description: Arthur Rides The Bandwagon: They all have their own names and personalities and they're so darned cute! They're Woogles, and Arthur's gotta have one. Especially now that everyone else (even the Rat!) is collecting them. But there aren't any more -- stores are sold out. Will Arthur grow up Woogle-less? Dad's Dessert Dilemma: Arthur wouldn't mind if Dad's infamous dessert "experiments" remained a family secret. But when Dad volunteers to cater a school party, Arthur fears the worst. What will Dad make this time: chunky pudding balls? Cranberry prune crumble?? Turnip ...

3.title: Popular Girls/Buster's Growing Grudge
3.description: Popular Girls: Sue Ellen and Fern take a popularity quiz they found in a magazine for teenagers. They change their personalities to become more likable, but why does it seem no one likes them anymore? Buster's Growing Grudge: Buster's convinced that his great joke will be the difference between a successful oral report and failure. But when Binky steals his material, will Buster stay mad forever?

3.title: Arthur's Treasure Hunt/The Return of the King
3.description: Arthur's Treasure Hunt: When Buster digs up an ancient arrowhead, everyone else wants to hunt for buried treasures, too. But how can Arthur become a famous discoverer of lost civilizations and stuff if his Mom won't let him dig up the back yard? The Return of The King: A field trip to the Medieval Fair pits Arthur's class against another led by Ratburn's super-tough mentor, Mr. Pryce-Jones. Arthur and the gang suffer defeat after humiliating defeat against the smarter, stronger competitors. Can Arthur save the day -- and be crowned king?

3.title: Attack of the Turbo Tibbles/D.W. Tricks the Tooth Fairy
3.description: Attack of The Turbo Tibbles: If you think the Tibbles are bad now, imagine what they'd be like if they had super powers! After sneaking a peak at the forbidden "Terrific Turbo-Trooper Toy T-Bot Team" TV show, the Tibbles are out of control. And when the play gets rough, somebody could get hurt! D.W. Tricks The Tooth Fairy: D.W. needs money, quick. After all, every girl wants to have her own Fluffy Unicorn Clothes-Horse and Horse-Clothes Barn. When she tries to pull a fast one on the Tooth Fairy, will Arthur have to pay?

3.title: Double Tibble Trouble/Arthur's Almost Live Not Real Music Festival
3.description: Double Tibble Trouble: Playing with the Tibble twins requires preparation, endurance and earplugs. But when one gets sick, playing with the other should be a lot easier -- shouldn't it? Arthur's Almost Live Not Real Music Festival: Arthur and the gang create their own music videos. What they lack in high-tech video gear, they make up for in state-of-the-art imaginations!

3.title: What Scared Sue Ellen?/Clarissa Is Cracked
3.description: What Scared Sue Ellen?: Sue Ellen's not afraid of much, but when she encounters a really creepy howling noise in the woods, she's scared for real. She musters the gang for a showdown. Will they face their fears and learn the source of the mysterious howls? Clarissa Is Cracked: Grandma Thora has a lot of fun stuff, especially her porcelain doll, Clarissa. When Grandma lends Clarissa to D.W. for a week they have the most wonderful adventures together. But...will all that fun blemish the fair Clarissa?

3.title: Arthur's Dummy Disaster/Francine and the Feline
3.description: Francine gets a new cat, but Arthur insists that cats are stupid.

3.title: Mom and Dad Have a Great Big Fight/D.W.'s Perfect Wish
3.description: Mom and Dad Have A Great Big Fight: When Mom and Dad fight over spilled milk, Arthur and D.W. fear the worst. Is it Arthur's fault or D.W.'s? And worse, will Mom or Dad have to move out? D.W.'s Perfect Wish: Turning five is a major, big deal event! But D.W. worries that she fribbled away her preschool years on meaningless pursuits. To make up for it, this year's birthday wish must be especially meaningful.

3.title: Arthur and D.W. Clean Up/The Long, Dull Winter
3.description: Arthur and D.W. Clean Up: Arthur just might make it to Happy Crazy Wow Day at the park -- if he and D.W. can work together to clean both their rooms! The Long, Dull Winter: What's wrong with Arthur? Is he bored? In love?? Arthur -- and the rest of the gang -- realize they are suffering from the January doldrums brought on by an acute lack of holidays. What's the cure? The kids decide to invent their own holiday.

4.title: D.W.'s Library Card/Arthur's Big Hit
4.description: D.W.'s Library Card: When D.W. discovers that she can get her own library card, she rejoices at the world of books waiting for her. (Now if only she could sign her name to get the card in the first place...) Arthur's Big Hit: Is it ever okay to hit someone? Sometimes you just get so mad, you wanna.... pow! Right?? Arthur experiences considerable confusion, and finally clarity, as he finds himself on both ends of the hitting question.

4.title: Hide and Snake/Muffy's New Best Friend
4.description: When a snake Arthur and his friends find the woods gets loose in the Read house, they have to find it before Arthur's parents find out or somebody gets hurt, because they think the snake might be poisonous.; Muffy tries to find a new "best friend" after she and Francine don't like doing the same things.

4.title: Buster's Breathless/The Fright Stuff
4.description: When D.W. has a brush with poison ivy, Buster tells a story about how he once got asthma. When Buster learns he has asthma, his friends start treating him differently, thinking that Buster needed special attention. Buster educates his friends by doing a science project about asthma. Muffy and Francine play several tricks on Arthur, Buster, Binky, and the Brain and invite them to a costume party at a haunted house. The boys decide to get vengeance on the girls at the party while Muffy and Francine are ready with another trick. They call off all pranks when they ...

4.title: The Contest/Prove It
4.description: Arthur and his friends enter a television contest./D.W. tries to prove she is smarter than Arthur.

4.title: The Blizzard/The Rat Who Came to Dinner
4.description: The Blizzard: A big blizzard comes to Elwood City, taking out the electricity (and--gasp--television!) and sending residents scrambling for supermarket supplies. Can neighbors find ways to help each other survive through the storm? The Rat Who Came To Dinner: The unthinkable is happening... Arthur's teacher is moving in! After his roof collapses, Mr. Ratburn stays with the Reads in order to teach and grade Arthur every second of the day! Or so Arthur fears.

4.title: D.W. Tale Spins/Prunella Gets It Twice
4.description: D.W. Tale Spins: What happens when you combine Greek Mythology with D.W.'s imagination? When Grandma Thora shows D.W. how to be a author of great stories without even knowing how to write, D.W. tells a fantastic tale (with a little help from Homer) that impresses even Arthur. Prunella Gets It Twice: Getting two Polly Locket dolls almost ruins Prunella's birthday party. That, and Francine's bad mood--why, she wouldn't even sing the Happy Birthday song! Wait... is there a connection? The Ghost of Presents Past appears to Prunella and shows her a thing or two about ...

4.title: Binky Barnes, Wingman!/To Beat or Not to Beat
4.description: Binky Barnes,Wingman: Does Binky have a favorite pastime? Not until citywide Bug Week, when suddenly all he can think about is butterflies. But is Binky's obsession with catching Big Blue Butterfly destined to make him the Captain Ahab of Elwood City? And what will become of Moby Dick... er, Big Blue, if it falls into Binky's clutches? To Beat Or Not To Beat: There's a horrible racket in Elwood City. Is it a sewer sucking machine? A turbo bug extermination device? No, it's Francine practicing her singing and drumming for the Talent Show! Should Arthur and the gang ...

4.title: 1001 Dads/Prunella's Prediction
4.description: 1001 Dads: When Buster cheerfully insists that he will miss the Father's Day picnic because he has other plans, Arthur is convinced that he's really sad about his parents' divorce and embarrassed to show up alone. Can Arthur and the gang find Buster a new dad in time for the picnic? Prunella's Prediction: When Rubella's tarot cards foresee the delivery of a special birthday present, Prunella predicts a gift of... flashpants, the hottest new fashion. When she gets a watch instead, Prunella can't bear to face the others, particularly since Muffy will be wearing them to ...

4.title: What Is That Thing?/Buster's Best Behavior
4.description: An unknown object is annoying D.W.; Buster misbehaves at Toys R Us and so he can't get a new toy.

4.title: My Music Rules/That's a Baby Show!
4.description: When the library is presenting a children's music show, they need a headlining act. DW wants it to be Yo Yo Ma, who she had recently seen at a concert, while Arthur and Francine try to get Joshua Redman.; Arthur secretly prefers watching "The Love Ducks" a show aimed at very young children, instead of the Batman-like "Dark Bunny" that his friends watch.

5.title: Arthur and the Big Riddle/Double Dare
5.description: Arthur And The Big Riddle: Alex Trebec guest stars as the famous host of "Riddle Quest," Alex Lebec. Arthur is going to be a contestant and his friends are a little too anxious to help in prepare. They may end up helping him over the edge. When he ends up in second place he becomes a hero, afterall for a lifetime supply of choco-sticks, second place IS the best! Double Dare: Arthur, Francine, Buster and Brain have all dared eachother to skip school so that they can watch "Dark Bunny" instead of doing homework. Francine doesn't get the message that everyone else has ...

5.title: Kids Are from Earth, Parents Are from Pluto/Nerves of Steal
5.description: Kid's Are From Earth, Parents Are From Mars: At least that's what it seems to Arthur and his friends when it's Open House Night at school. It happens every year without fail and everyone works very hard to keep their parents' "embarrassing" personalities at home. Nerves of Steal: It seems that everyone on Earth has a Cybertoy. Everyone that is except Arthur and Buster. Will Buster stoop to criminal activity in order to feel a part of the crowd or will his conscience get the better of him?

5.title: It's a No-Brainer/The Shore Thing
5.description: It's A No-Brainer: When Brain loses his cool and loses to Buster in the Math-a-thon, he abandons his books and nickname for a career in... stand-up comedy?!? Is The Brain gone forever? The Shore Thing: Arthur and D.W. beg Dad to take them to Aqualand -- the coolest water park ever! But he says that he knows an even better place... 'Ocean Zone.' The kids explore the old-fashioned ocean, and find all kinds of cool sea stuff by the sea shore.

5.title: The World Record/The Cave
5.description: The World Record: Why is Buster walking backwards... and Muffy not talking? They're trying to set world records of course! Everyone tries to go it alone, but Arthur and the gang discover that working together more readily creates success, fun... and the world's largest pizza! The Cave: talactites and stalagmites and bats, oh my! Arthur thinks his class trip to the Clark Caves will be really cool... but won't it be, um, dark in there??

5.title: The Lousy Week/You Are Arthur...
5.description: Arthur's school is struck with a lice outbreak; Arthur invites viewers to experience what the world is like from his point of view.

5.title: The Election/Francine Goes to War
5.description: The Election: 'I, Muffy Crosswire, do solemnly swear to uphold the office of the President of the United ...' Actually, it's only a mock election in Mr. Ratburn's class, but Muffy takes it just as seriously. How far will she go to win? Francine Goes to War: Francine can't believe it. She gets in trouble no matter what she does -- thanks to the new nosy next-door neighbor! Will Francine get to play her drums... or fight with her sister... ever again??

5.title: Sleep No More/Pet Peeved
5.description: Sleep No More: Have you ever been so excited that you couldn't sleep? Buster is convinced that Pizza Paula's all-you-can-eat contest... free pizza for life!... is his destiny. But how can he possibly win such an important contest without any sleep? Pet Peeved: Binky volunteers to look after Francine's cat, Nemo, for the weekend. Boy, this'll be great... all fun and games and surprise toys! But when Binky ignores Francine's cat-sitting instructions, Nemo has a few surprises in store of his own.

5.title: The Last of Mary Moo Cow/Bitzi's Beau
5.description: DW's favorite TV show is canceled; Buster's mother gets a new boyfriend.

5.title: Just Desserts/The Big Dig
5.description: Just Desserts: Arthur has a hard time resisting sweets, and one evening his overindulgence wins him an upset stomach and a series of rather 'Grimm' dreams... starring Mr. Ratburn as a child-eating witch, the Tibbles as seven dwarves, and a fearsome giant made entirely of food! The Big Dig: Arthur and D.W. used to love it when Grandpa Dave came to visit -- but now he only wants to sleep and play checkers. Then one day Grandpa Dave shares a secret map, and Arthur and D.W. hunt for a buried treasure and discover some family history.

5.title: Arthur's Family Feud/Muffy Gets Mature
5.description: After a soufflÃ©, their father baked is destroyed, Arthur and DW try to explain to him what happened.; Muffy thinks Francine acts too immature, so she becomes friends with Francine's older sister.

5.title: Muffy's Tape/A Kid named CraftLover346
5.description: Muffy's Tape: Muffy discovers an old cassette tape of an woman that resembles her warning her about her selfishness and it how it get her in the future. A Kid named CraftLover346: Buster goes on a chat forum website where he chat with others, until he meets another kid named CraftLover346, when he meets the user it turns out be a 56-year-old man named Ronald Patrick who is infamous for luring kids into his house and being creepy.

6.title: Sue Ellen Gets Her Goose Cooked/Best of the Nest
6.description: Sue Ellen Gets Her Goose Cooked: Sue Ellen is the champion of the popular Internet game, Virtualgoose.com. She becomes so obsessed, however, that she starts imagining her friends as geese to be conquered! Can Sue Ellen give up Virtualgoose before she finally quacks...er, cracks? Best of The Nest: Now that the gang has beaten Virtualgoose, they move onto Best of the Nest, where five geese fight to survive in the virtual woods. As the competition escalates, Brain becomes inspired to initiate a camping trip in the real woods. Will any of his friends be willing to forgo ...

6.title: Arthur Plays the Blues/Buster's Sweet Success
6.description: Arthur gets a strict new piano teacher; Buster creates a new candy which he sells to raise money for the school band.

6.title: Prunella's Special Edition/The Secret Life of Dogs and Babies
6.description: Prunella orders a special edition of the latest "Henry Skreever" book, but she gets a braille copy by mistake.; Arthur's dog, Pal and Kate, his baby sister can actually talk to each other, but older people cannot understand it.

6.title: Muffy's Soccer Shocker/Brother Can You Spare a Clarinet?
6.description: Muffy's father is the new soccer coach.;Binky has doubts about his musical talents.

6.title: The Boy Who Cried Comet!/Arthur and Los Vecinos
6.description: Buster sees a comet which he thinks it headed to Earth, but nobody believes him; The Vecinos, an Ecuadorian family move next door to the Reads.

6.title: Citizen Frensky/D.W.'s Backpack Mishap
6.description: Citizen Frensky: After visiting The Elwood City Times, Francine decides to start her own paper-The Frensky Star! The tabloid, complete with embarrassing photos and sensationalized headlines, is a smashing success...until all her friends stop speaking to her. D.W.'s Backpack Mishap: Somebody stole D.W.'s backpack!! Who is this fluffy unicorn thief... this Mary Moo Cow-napper? In the backpack left behind, D.W. finds clues in an assortment of exotic objects. Could the backpack thief be even more sinister than she imagined-or just well traveled?

6.title: The Boy with his Head in the Clouds/More!
6.description: George, one of Arthur's classmates, learns that he is dyslexic; DW gets her first allowance, but becomes when her friends tell her they have more money.

6.title: Rhyme for Your Life/For Whom the Bell Tolls
6.description: Rhyme for Your Life: While struggling to write a poem for his mom, Binky falls asleep and gets trapped in Verseberg... where it's a crime not to rhyme! After tangling with the big purple orange and meeting poet William Carlos Williams, Binky finally escapes this curse-but will he be able to stop speaking in verse?? For Whom The Bell Tolls: D.W. lost her voice! For Arthur it's a dream come true...until Mom asks Arthur to take care of D.W., and he finds himself at the mercy of a bad mime with a cowbell. Will Arthur spend the rest of his life at D.W.'s beck and call, ...

6.title: The Good Sport/Crushed
6.description: The Good Sport: When the Athlete of the Year Award doesn't go to Francine, she makes no effort to hide her hurt feelings from Jenna, the recipient. Michelle Kwan, world champion figure skater and graduate of Lakewood Elementary (who knew?), guest stars to teach Francine about good sports(wo)manship. Crushed: Arthur can't believe his parents are hiring a babysitter-he's 8-years-old! Besides, babysitters are b-o-r-i-n-g! But 16-year-old Sally MacGill's favorite hobbies are eating ice cream and playing the Dark Bunny VI: Curse of the Moomy videogame, and now all Arthur ...

6.title: Arthur Loses His Marbles/Friday the 13th
6.description: Arthur Loses His Marbles: When Arthur discovers that Grandma Thora is a marbles champion, he trains with her so he can beat all his friends. And though Thora teaches Arthur everything he knows, she doesn't teach him everything she knows... and it's Read versus Read in the first-ever Elwood City Marbles Tournament. Friday The 13th: Brain doesn't believe in superstitions, even though his friends step over sidewalk cracks... and even Mr.Ratburn walks around ladders. So when Brain's defiance leads to a string of bad luck, he's stunned. Can he reverse the trend before the ...

7.title: Arthur, It's Only Rock and Roll
7.description: A Backstreet Boys' concert tour stop in Elwood City is the backdrop for this musical special. For Muffy, their imminent arrival brings to fruition her crush on Backstreet Boy heartthrob Nick Carter.

7.title: Cast Away/The Great Sock Mystery
7.description: Arthur is thrilled when Dad invites him to go fly fishing for the weekend. Finally - an escape from D.W.! But when a change in plans forces them to include her, Arthur's had enough. Does D.W. always have to get her own way?

7.title: Francine's Split Decision/Muffy Goes Metropolitan
7.description: Muffy gets the chance to go with Sue-Ellen to the glamorous metropolis of Crown City, but when her fantasies don't play out as planned, can she learn to appreciate all the city has to offer, anyway?

7.title: Ants in Arthur's Pants/Don't Ask Muffy
7.description: Arthur wants to prove he has what it takes to fit Mr. Ratburn's science criteria, but when his project runs amok, how can he? Meanwhile Muffy starts an advice column, but she's got a reluctant friend helping her along.

7.title: To Tibble the Truth/Waiting to Go
7.description: The Tibble Twins unintentionally hurt people's feelings when they decide to start telling the truth. / Two children are stuck together when their parents don't arrive to pick them up from soccer practice.

7.title: Elwood City Turns 100!
